revised_title: The Coagulation of Blood: A Review of Theories and Experiments
tldr: This lecture by Joseph Lister reviews the various theories and experiments surrounding blood coagulation, discussing the essential nature of the process, the role of vital properties, and the causes of coagulation when blood is removed from the body. Lister presents his own experiments and findings, questioning the ammonia theory and exploring alternative explanations for the fluidity and coagulation of blood.
